phrase.item: Greeting to all the Wakhi speakers.
I want you all to be safe and healthy.
So I am going to tell you about myself.
From my childhood I always wanted to learn computer science.
Currently I am studying at university in Khorog.
So today I met our brother [Nazir] and was extremely happy that our language has gone that far and is developing. Our brother wants our language not to do disappear.
So he came all the way from New York to Badakhshan, to [record] our language, take it there and improve and preserve it.
We are very happy meeting him today. We all want our language not to disappear and our traditional clothing to remain as well, everywhere we will be recognized.
Our language has value, as well our traditional clothing.
The outfit which I am wearing today
And it is not easy to make.
Some of our people don't use it that much.
We must use [all] of these things and the Wakhi language should not go from us and our traditional clothing should not go away either.
Whoever sees and hears me, may you all always be happy.
